group_1.textLeft: What are you talking about…?

group_1.textRight: I've suspected for a long time now that Heruka@wasn't human.
Thus, I underwent an investigation of her, and…@I found that at night, she takes a grisly form.
I was as helpless as a newborn before@the might of a Rakshasi…
Other monks attempted to fight back,@but all of them fell before her.
I barely escaped with my life.
…Who is that man over there?@What's he saying?

group_1.textLeft: Dolma, please translate.

group_1.textRight: No… How could you expect me to spout@such lies?

group_1.textLeft: Besides, he can speak for himself!
He's the one who taught us Mongolian@in the first place, after all.

group_1.textRight: I don't recall doing that…@Only that I had given you some manuscripts…
…so that we could bring knowledge to the@Mongolian people of Heruka's misdeeds!

group_1.textLeft: STOP LYING!
Please, translate for him! Hurry!

group_1.textRight: Why… Why are you making me do this…?
Hey, Heruka…@WHY ME?!

group_1.textLeft: Dolma, you are here to serve as our interpreter.
If you cannot fulfill that duty, then you have@no right to be here.

group_1.textRight: Mmph?!
Wh-what…?@Is this why you brought the Lama here…?

group_1.narration: Yes. If it were just you,@I knew you would try to protect me.
We grew up in the same hometown,@practically as twins.
Given your behavior…@You'd be branded as a Rakshasi too.
And I'll never allow that.@I'll protect you…Dolma!

group_1.textLeft: Hah… I didn't expect a witness like him@to come and ruin everything.

group_1.textRight: What do you mean?

group_1.textLeft: That monk was our former Lama…@He saw my true form.
That's why I tried to kill him...@But it looks like he slipped away.

group_1.textRight: …Hm, so he saw your true form, then.
You, interpreter.@You were both in the same nunnery, yes?
Have you seen her true form as well?

group_1.textLeft: No, I haven't!@It's all bullshit!

group_1.textRight: You're certainly invested in defending Heruka…

group_1.textLeft: Because she's lying!
She's sacrificing herself in order to protect@everyone!

group_1.textRight: But she would be executed for this…@People don't normally throw their lives away.
And not just their lives, but to have their names@go down in infamy for all time…
She will be despised forevermore!

group_1.textLeft: But Heruka isn't ordinary!@She's special!

group_1.textRight: Special or not, it will tarnish her entire lineage…@How absurd.

group_1.textLeft: Heruka doesn't have any family left after what@you did!

group_1.textRight: What…?

group_1.textLeft: You burned down our home!

group_1.textRight: …So both of you hail from the same hometown@AND the same nunnery…
I had thought you were simply very protective@of her, but…
Are you a Rakshasi too?

group_1.narration: Perish the thought…!

group_1.textCenter: A worthless defect like her can't possibly@be a Rakshasi.
She's always been a dead weight clinging@onto me ever since we were children…
For whatever reason I can't fathom,@she's quite attached to me…

group_1.narration: …Nngh. Every word pains me…@I don't want to say these things to Dolma…
But…I have to keep spurring myself onward…!@If I stop now, all of this will be for nothing!
Come on! I need to spit it out!@Silence breeds misunderstandings…!
Wasn't this all for her sake to begin with?
Isn't that why I decided to become special…?!@Mngh…!

group_1.textCenter: Dolma…has been nothing but a pest.@I truly hate her with all of my heart.
He-Heruka…

group_1.textLeft: She said that about Dolma…

group_1.textRight: Dolma has been more devoted to her@than any of us…!

group_1.textCenter: Everyone, stop!
I know…I know all of this is a lie…

group_1.textRight: But… Please don't say things like that,@even if you're lying…

group_1.textLeft: …You're so naive.@That's why you were so easily tricked.
I'm the one who killed everyone@in our hometown!
I'm the one who killed your mother!

group_1.textRight: Th-that's…@None of that was your fault!
So it was Heruka's fault?

group_1.textLeft: Ah, no… It wasn't!

group_1.textCenter: Wrong!
I'm the one who killed everyone@in our hometown.
It was just an experiment, you see.
I wanted to see how far I could manipulate@people with my magic,
using them as decoys so I could escape@your notice.

group_1.narration: That's right, I was just using her…@I have to convince them that I@wasn't just manipulating Dolma,@but everyone else as well.
"I went to the nunnery because@it was convenient."
"What with all the girls gathered there,@if one or two were to disappear..."
"No one would notice, really."
If I can convince them that@everyone was being deceived by me,@and weren't involved with the Rakshasi…@I can protect them all.

group_1.textCenter: These fools I gathered were no different…@They were simply convenient tools.
They invested their faith in me right away.@They were easy pawns.

group_1.narration: My power can save them all.

group_1.textCenter: I figured I could have them plunder whatever@village that caught my eye…
But they're all useless good-for-nothings.
There's no point in having them around@if they can't get me money.
Yes, money! All of this was about money.@Enough of this "salvation" nonsense.

group_1.narration: I'm so happy I can protect you all.
Do I really deserve this…?@This is such a reward…to let someone like me@live such a blessed, worthy life…

group_1.textLeft: To think she would make such a mockery@of my own compatriots…

group_1.textRight: Someone like her could never be deserving@of the Buddha's blessings…!

group_1.textLeft: I always thought there was a darker side to her,@with the way she proclaimed herself the savior…

group_1.textRight: She even called herself Lama in order@to deceive us…!

group_1.textCenter: Yes, she is truly evil…@She is a Rakshasi!

group_1.narration: [bgEffect:shakeSmall]"Rakshasi!@A wicked Rakshasi!"
Their hatred grows...as if by force.

group_1.textCenter: …Here it comes, just as I anticipated.
Do we give her execution?!@Or do we grant her mercy?!

group_1.narration: [bgEffect:shakeLarge]"EXECUTION! EXECUTION!"

group_1.textCenter: Then by the will of the Tibetan people,@I shall execute her!

group_1.textLeft: Stop! Why is this happening?!

group_1.textRight: …Open your eyes.@This is her true nature!

group_1.narration: The soldiers pity Dolma…@There shouldn't be any problems, then.
Dolma will be a poor victim of my deception,@rather than a suspected Rakshasi…

group_1.textRight: [chara:105101:effect_shake]Come with me!

group_1.textLeft: Wait! Heruka!

group_1.textRight: Cut that out!

group_1.textLeft: Heruka…! Ah…!

group_1.narration: Dolma…@Please don't cry…
The battle isn't over yet.

group_1.textCenter: And so at last we meet…the Witch.

group_1.textRight: Sh-she's transformed!

group_1.textLeft: The Rakshasi escaped!@After her! AFTER HER!

group_1.narration: I will defeat it…@I've done all this to lure it out…
The Witch…@The true source of all this!
